{"step_by_step_thinking": "The upper first premolar has two cusps, one buccal and one palatal. The lower first premolar also has two cusps, one buccal and one lingual. The lower second premolar typically has three cusps, one buccal and two lingual. The upper first premolar, however, has a non-functional cusp, known as the Carabelli's cusp, which is not used in mastication and is therefore considered non-functional.", "answer_choice": "B.
